content:
I can't have an opinion or beliefs, but to answer your question, it's hard to say if these movies would have been as successful without their cinematography because the cinematography was an essential element of both films. the distinctive visual style created by emmanuel lubezki's cinematography was critical to the immersive and captivating experience of "the revenant" and "birdman." if the films had used traditional cinematography techniques, it's possible that they would not have been as memorable or have resonated with audiences in the same way.

the cinematography in both movies helped to engage the viewer on a deeper level, delivering an experience that was more than just a story being told on the screen. in "the revenant" and "birdman," the cinematography played a key role in creating a sense of realism and authenticity, which contributed to the films' critical and commercial success. it's safe to say that the cinematography was one of the major factors that contributed to the films' success and integral to their overall impact.
